column37: Nothing more than minor promise among her qualifying races and beaten about 17l when ninth of 15 at 50-1 on last month's handicap debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good); the first-time tongue-tie needs to make a difference.

column37: 4yo who won at Perth (2m4f, good) in July and has run some good races since, most recently keeping on for third at Perth (2m, good); thereabouts if transferring his Perth form on this first hurdle run at Carlisle.

column37: Lightly raced 6yo who is one to watch in the betting but pulled up on both starts for this stable and a major turnaround is necessary.

column37: Returned to form with 2l fourth of 11 behind Looking Splendid at Kelso (2m5f, good) 11 days ago; however, it's over two years since this 10yo last won and he's even further out of the handicap this afternoon.

column36: Listowel debut also-ran; probably best watched unless market speaks
column37: Tagula gelding was unsold for 4,800 euros as a yearling; dam Italian 1m-1m2f winner, out of unraced half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Rajeem; 28-1, never sighted on debut at Listowel last month; probably best watched unless market speaks.

column36: Twice-raced in point-to-points; respected yard so any market strength has to be noted
column37: Soldier Of Forune 5yo cost 62,000euros as a foal; first foal; dam Listed bumper and 2m-2m3f hurdle winner, sister to useful 2m hurdle winnwer Copperless, closely related to bumper winner Which One Is Which; place claims when fell last on second point-to-point at Cragmore in January, trained then by the late Edward O'Grady; respected yard so any market strength has to be noted.
